paper_abstract: Mobile agents (MAs) are autonomous computing entities that dwell in agent platforms and have the ability to move to different locations as needed They are typically composed of code, data, and a state The performance of MA migrations is always penalized by the need of carrying these components to each visited location In contrast to the agent data and state, the agent code is static during the whole agent life Therefore, optimizing the agent code management, the agent migration performance can be improved The main contribution of this article is the definition of a global cache service has been developed, and its benefits have been extensively demonstrated by a set of performance tests carried out in different scenarios Copyright (C) 2010 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd
paper_title: An efficient and secure agent code distribution service
